thread.title: The Patriots failed to score in the first quarter for the seventh straight Super Bowl
thread.title_full: The Patriots failed to score in the first quarter for the seventh straight Super Bowl

title: The Patriots failed to score in the first quarter for the seventh straight Super Bowl
text:
Feb 5, 2017 at 7:37p ET 0Shares 
For the seventh time in a row, the New England Patriots failed to get on the scoreboard in the first quarter of a Super Bowl. They were held to zero points against the Falcons, which extends one of the most bizarre streaks in NFL history. 
The last time the Patriots scored a point in the first quarter of a Super Bowl was in 1997 against the Green Bay Packers. That was when Drew Bledsoe was at quarterback and Bill Parcells was the head coach. Tom Brady has still NEVER scored a point in the first quarter of a Super Bowl. 0 for 7 
— Dr Cork Gaines (@CorkGaines) February 6, 2017 
In the Bill Belichick-Tom Brady era, the Patriots have never scored in the first quarter of a Super Bowl. That’s absolutely incredible. 
What’s even more odd is that the Falcons and Patriots ranked first and second in first-quarter scoring this season. Yet they finished with zero points in the first quarter of Super Bowl LI.
